benchmark_details.name: OpenWebMath
benchmark_details.overview: OpenWebMath is an open dataset containing 14.7B tokens of high-quality mathematical webpages extracted from Common Crawl, aimed at improving the reasoning capabilities of large language models.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide an open dataset for training large language models on mathematical texts to enhance their mathematical reasoning capabilities.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset is limited to English mathematical content and may exclude important documents with non-English content.

data.annotation: No manual annotation; relies on extraction from source material.

methodology.calculation: Perplexity is calculated on variety of mathematics benchmarks to measure model performance.
methodology.interpretation: Lower perplexity indicates better performance on mathematical reasoning tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: Models trained on OpenWebMath outperform those trained on over 20x the amount of general data.
methodology.validation: Performance validated through downstream task evaluations on mathematical benchmarks.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Limited to English sources; potential exclusion of non-English mathematical resources.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: ODC-By 1.0 license; users must also abide by Common Crawl terms of use.
